sen.j: 小堀 正優（こぼり まさやす、天明6年（1786年） － 慶応3年6月24日 (旧暦)（1867年7月25日））は、江戸時代末期の旗本。
sen.e: Masayasu KOBORI (1783-July 25, 1867) was a hatamoto (direct retainer of a shogun) in the late Edo period.
Masayasu KOBORI (1786-July 25, 1867) was a hatamoto (direct retainer of a shogun) in the late Edo period.

He was the son of Masahisa KOBORI.

sen.e: He was the son of Masahisa KOBORI.

sen.j: 遠州流茶道8世家元で号は宗中。
sen.e: He was the 8th head of the Enshu-school Tea Ceremony, and his pseudonym was 'Sochu.'

sen.j: 天明8年(1788年)5月6日に改易された近江小室藩主小堀政方の甥にあたる。
sen.e: Masayasu was a nephew of Masamichi KOBORI, the lord of the Omi Komuro Domain, which was confiscated on June 9, 1788.

sen.e: Masayasu was the nephew of Masamichi KOBORI, the lord of the Omi Komuro Domain, who was punished by dismissal and deprivation of their positions, privileges and properties on June 9, 1788.

sen.e: Masayasu was the nephew of Masamichi KOBORI, the lord of the Omi Komuro Domain, who was punished by dismissal and deprivation of their positions, privileges and properties on June 9, 1788.

sen.j: 同地に生を受けるが改易後は、京の孤篷庵で過ごす。
sen.e: He was born in Omi Province, but lived at Koho-an Temple in Kyoto after the confiscation of the Omi Komuro Domain.

sen.j: 文政11年(1828年)に政優に300俵を与えられ、小堀氏は旗本として再興された。
sen.e: In 1828, Masayasu was conferred 300 bales (1,800 kilograms) of salary, and the Kobori family was resuscitated as a hatamoto.
In 1828, Masayasu was conferred 300 bales (1,800 kilograms) of rice, and the Kobori family was reinstated as the hatamoto.
sen.cmt: スペースが２つ入っています。300俵は、300 bales (1,800 kilograms) of riceだと思います。
sen.e: In 1828, Masayasu was conferred 300 bales (1,800 kilograms) of rice, and the Kobori family was reinstated as the hatamoto.

sen.j: 家督と家元は子の小堀正和が継いだ。
sen.e: The positions of family head and school head were succeeded by his son, Masakazu KOBORI.
His son, Masakazu KOBORI succeeded to the positions of family head and school head.
